properties.areaDesc: Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso/Western Hudspeth Counties; Salt Basin; Otero Mesa; Northern Hudspeth Highlands/Hueco Mountains; Southern Hudspeth Highlands; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 11:08AM MST until February 5 at 11:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS, THE EASTERN
LOWLANDS OF OTERO COUNTY, AND HUDSPETH COUNTY...

.Winter storm continues for the Sacramento Mountains and will
spread to much of the other lowlands east of the Rio Grande Valley
tonight. Some moderate to heavy snow is currently falling over the
Sacramento Mountains and should continue into Wednesday morning.
The east slopes and central portion of the mountains are expected
to receive the heaviest snowfall as low level east flow increases
throughout tonight. Elsewhere some rain showers will continue
across the lowlands east of the Rio Grande Valley through early
this evening. This rain will turn to snow by late evening as low
level east flow increases. Some snow accumulation is expected
across Hudspeth County and the lowlands of Otero County. The snow
should taper off and end by around noon on Wednesday.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with
a few localized areas up to 5 inches.

* WHEN...Rain turning to snow late evening and continuing into
Wednesday morning before tapering off and ending.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Local areas of up to 5 inches possible near
east slopes of terrain such as the Hueco Mountains.

* WHERE...Hudspeth County and eastern portions of Otero County.

* TIMING...From 11 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Snowfall will create slick roads and reduce
visibility making for hazardous travel conditions. Road
closures will be possible, including I-10 through Hudspeth
County.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY
